config.question: Which of the following led to Portugal’s lack of interest in Columbus’s plan to find new trade routes by crossing the Atlantic Ocean and increased Spanish interest in the venture?

choices.content: greater interaction between the British and the Native Americans
Portugal’s established trade routes along the coast of Africa
the success of the British in finding a northwest passage to India and China
the predominance of Catholicism in Portugal

answer_3.response: Consider This: The first Europeans who reached the West African coast hoped to establish contact with the civilizations of central and eastern Asia. Europeans who sailed around Africa hoped to bypass middlemen in the Middle East who had long dominated control of silks and spices. See L.O. 1.2 How did Europeans interact with West Africans and Native Americans during the fifteenth through seventeenth centuries?
